fields.description:
I always find it annoying when I am just trying to view some source code in FishEye, and end up for some reason landing on the list of file revisions...

AFAICT, this happens for two reasons - probably more:

h2. The file tree contains the ?r=HEAD, but not the file list when browsing.
!http://img.skitch.com/20100917-815aid6mcudxhjx88ay37y6ru9.gif!

When browsing files, if you click the source tab once, then all other files you click will also go to the source tab. Except in the above place.


h2. When searching, the filename links to the filehistory, and the revision number links to the source? How does that work?

IMO - this should be reversed:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100917-jhxdxkx39ugms7anij2u6ijmcc.gif!
fields.summary: Make the Source tab more sticky - consider a cookie?

fields.description:

fields.description:
Currently, Crucible uses table based rendering, which could potentially blow out the DOM with large reviews (i.e., greater than 1000~ lines of diffs). 

The solution is to progressively render each line of diff, so that there isn't so many dom elements. This has been implemented in Fisheye's side-by-side view, and should be used in crucible. 

The problem may be in how we might have to render comments associated with the diff. Not sure how that can be solved yet.
fields.summary: Make Crucible reviews use progressive rendering of diffs

fields.description:
When the atlassian functest plugin:
https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/FP/trunk/functest-plugin
embeds atlassian selenium:
https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/SELENIUM/trunk

we should move to using the atlassian functest plugin for the following reasons:

* our dev speed should increase - since the atlassian-functest plugin will contain all the webdriver libraries and will not need to be redployed for each change to a test. Our test plugin will be much smaller in size, meaning a reduction in deployment time.
* we can use the auto-install of browsers for different OS's if need be - this makes CI a lot easier!
* we can use some of the helper methods provided by atlassian selenium for webdriver
fields.summary: Migrate to using the common Atlassian Functest plugin

fields.description:
As per the documentation here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Customising+Email+Notifications

You should be able to modify the {{crucible-notification-subject.ftl}} file to change the subject of the Crucible notifications.  However this seems to be broken.  I tried:

1. Shut down Crucible.
2. Modify the file contents to:
{noformat}Subject: TESTING ${notification.emailSubject}{noformat}
3. Start Crucible.

When the email is received I would expect {{TESTING}} to be in the subject, however it isn't.
fields.summary: Email Subject template does not allow for modification

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create an inline comment on multiple lines of source (e.g., line 1 and line 3) and save
# Edit the comment and remove the last selected line (e.g., line 3) and save

Expected:
Comment appears under line 1, and is linked only to line 1.

Actual:
Comment appears under line 1, but is linked to lines 1 and 3.  Clicking edit causes a comment form to appear under line 3.


Cause:
FRXCommentAjaxAction is correctly updating the lineRanges on save, but is sending back HTML with the pre-save lineRanges (resp.inlineCommentHTML is wrong).  I *think* it has to do with makeComment() [and thus {{session.get(Comment.class, id)}}] being used to emit the html, but modifications being done on the InlineComment returned from {{session.get(InlineComment.class, id)}}.
fields.summary: When changing line selection on inline comment, response html is out of date

fields.description:
When a Crucible review is created using the link at the bottom of the Fisheye tab in a Jira issue, the Objectives field is populated with the contents of the Jira issue, but no link to the changeset is added.
This makes it impossible to determine what changeset the review is for from the Crucible review (Fisheye appears to know, as it displays the review in the changeset view, but I can't see any way to discover that information from the Crucible review view.

Compare this with when a review is created from the Fisheye changeset view, where a changeset link is created at the top of the Objectives content.
fields.summary: Include link to Fisheye changeset in Objectives when creating review from Jira Fisheye tab

fields.description:
When creating a review from the Jira Changeset Review Coverage gadget (by selecting a changeset(s) and clicking _Create Review_), the changesets are not associated with the review that is created, and no outcome etc. fields are populated in the new review.
This reduces the usefulness of the gadget considerably, as we have to open each changeset in Fisheye and create the review from there.

In the URL sent to Crucible, I can see the selected changesets referenced.

We have multiple projects configured in Crucible, and the first screen displayed after clicking _Create Review_ is a project selector.

The only other unusual thing about our setup is that we have the default project locked down (with a permission scheme) so noone can create reviews.
fields.summary: Changeset not associated with review when created from Changeset Review Coverage gadget

fields.description:
Its always a good idea to keep reviews as small, concise and focused.  However, our commits are not always like that.  

It would be great if crucible could provide an _easy_ way to divide a change set into multiple reviews making sure.  Or maybe 'extract' some stuff out of an existing review into a new review.

The utility would help ensure that the revisions in the reviews are all correct, and help ensure you don't miss anything.

I realise that this *should* be achievable by managing files, but its clunky, error prone and also buggy.
fields.summary: Provide utilities/an easy way to split changesets into multiple reviews

fields.description:
Similar to Jira. The main link area will continue to function as is. The addition of a drop-down arrow next to each main menu item (except the dashboard). When clicked, the drop-down would present the last few options you visited:
- Source would present the last 5 repos you visited. Clicking on one of these would be the same as clicking on source, then clicking on the repo you want to view
- Projects would present the last 5 projects you visited. Clicking on one of these would be the same as clicking on projects, then clicking on the project you are after
- People would present the last 5 people you visited
- Reviews should present the last 5 reviews you have visited, but at the top it should also present links to "inbox /(x/)" and "outbox /(x/)" where x = the number of items in each of those boxes.

Full spec here on EAC: https://extranet.atlassian.com/x/6gkbbw

fields.description:
Talk to me (Tom) about this

*Notes from talk with Tom:*
Problems may occur when upgrading from HSQL to MySQL or PostgreSQL.
* If you have data in your database created by older versions of Crucible, you may have fields with too much data in them, as HSQL does not enforce this.
* Hence, when you upgrade you will get a log warning stating that data in a particular field is too long and has been truncated.
* There are two cases to consider for data truncation:
*# Data is truncated for a db column which is a key (i.e. revision ID). If this is the case, the upgrade will fail. This would typically occur if customer used ClearCase which creates long revision names. To address this, customer will need to raise a support request.
*# Data is truncated for a non-key field. Typically for a revision name. For example, if a review is created from a comment message, the revision name may be too long and will be truncated. The customer does not need to do anything to address this, although they may want to rename the field.

_Error string for scenario 1:_
"The value of column <table name.column name>, has a length of <length> which is greater than the maximum allowed length for this column of <max size of column>. As this column is part of a unique index, the migration cannot be completed."
_Error string for scenario 2:_
"Truncating value of column <table name.column name> from '<old value>' to '<value>' because its length of <length of old value> is greater than the maximum allowed length for this column of <max size of column>."

*Pages to update:*
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Migrating+to+an+External+Database
fields.summary: Document Messages which may appear during migration

fields.description:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100829-mgc8wu9nk7dsf2myyjcf2bemtw.jpg!

- Panel above file tree affects all content below this point (both left and right panes)
- The statistics tab will remain there on the left for now, and will also be filtered by the branch selector
- *NOTE:* If FE cannot determine the trunk of a repo, the admin system will need to prompt the user to tell it which directory is the trunk when first adding the repo. For customers who are already set up and upgrade, but for some reason it's not picking up trunk, we should display a message where the tree is supposed to appear. Something like: "FishEye cannot determine the main branch of your repository. Please log into the admin system and select this project's main branch"
- FE attempts to select a "home branch" for the "branches" selector. This will be done by detecting which branch, other than trunk, the user has last committed to. If the user has never committed to a branch on this repo, then the branch selector simply says "Branch: select... ▾"
- Once the user sets their "home branch" this control will become sticky (via a cookie pref)
- The branch selector will be a combined type-ahead and pull-down control
- The branch selector will need to show some sort of path in case you have more than one branch with the same name in different locations
- Q: Should we also include tags in this selector, or should we move them to within the cog tool menu?
- Once a branch is indicated in this selector, it will only show the branch name, not the path
- A pencil icon will appear to the right of a branch selector with a branch name in it indicating to the user the selector is editable.
- Clicking on the pencil should clear the selection and activate the type-ahead control, but have an "x" escape route if the user does not wish to change the branch
- Clicking on the "x" will return the selection to it's former state
- If the branch is currently selected, clicking on the branch selector (not the pencil) will do nothing
- If the trunk is currently selected, clicking on the branch selector (not the pencil) refreshes the page, filtering all views to the selected branch
fields.summary: Create an advanced branch selector

fields.description:
Redesign of the revision list contents.

!http://img.skitch.com/20100829-e35p8148ahrqt93usc5c7schgb.jpg!

- Stuff to do with the actual file is in the larger grey section. Stuff to do with the whole changeset is in the central white area. This will help to scan the page better since we are now going to be using more than one line for each revision 
- Existing links will be placed in a "tools" cog menu 
- Each revision will initially take up a structured 4 lines of screen real estate 
- The commit message should initially be truncated as shown in the mockups 
- Expanding the revision using the "more" twixie will show any extra info, plus the entire commit message if it was truncated 
- If there is no extra info and the message has not been truncated the "more" twixie will say "No more" and the twixie will be disabled 
- If there is no "copied/moved/from/to" data then each one of these lines will just be collapsed 
- If there is no content for "Branch point for", "Tags" or "Properties" then all three sections should be hidden. However, if there is content for even one of these, all should be shown, with "(none)" if no content for that particular field. Eg, if the file has properties, then those properties will be shown, plus "Branch point for: (none)" and "Tags: (none)" 
- Each of these extra fields will show a maximum of 3 lines of results, then a (+x more) if there is more. This will be a link as shown in the mockup. When clicked, the list will be expanded to show all results.
